meanings.definition: To make something appear old-fashioned or outdated.
meanings.sent1: She archaized her room by decorating it with vintage furniture.
meanings.sent2: The artist archaized the painting to give it a retro look.
meanings.sent3: The kids archaized their school project to look like an ancient artifact.
meanings.sent4: His speech archaized the audience back to a time of simpler traditions.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop archaized the storefront to attract nostalgic customers.

meanings.definition: To imitate or copy the style or characteristics of something from a previous time period.
meanings.sent1: The fashion designer archaized the 1920s look for the runway show.
meanings.sent2: The movie director archaized the film to resemble a classic noir movie.
meanings.sent3: The chef archaized the recipe from an ancient cookbook for a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style archaized the great authors of the past.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit archaized the ancient artifacts for a new generation to appreciate.
